text:
Turkey
Morocco: Dirar extends to Fenerbahce
The former AS Monaco has decided to extend the adventure with the Turkish club, with which he is now bound until 2022.
05 Nov 2019, 14:00 by Thomas Rassouli



Top 5 players of the group stageTop 5 players who scored the first round of this CAN 2019IconSport



Youcef Belaili (Algeria) Just like his team, Belaili particularly shone during this group phase. With 9 points out of 9 possible, Algeria made a strong impression in this beginning of CAN. Single scorer against Senegal, the Esperance Tunis player has shown that we can count on him at major events.IconSport



Trezeguet (Egypt) At the age of 24, Trezeguet seems to be flourishing in this CAN, which is taking place in his homeland. Kasimpasa's attacker scored the first goal of the Pharaohs and therefore the first goal of the competition against Zimbabwe. A crucial achievement that has allowed Egypt to free itself from the pressure of organizing an event like the Africa Cup of Nations at home.IconSport



Yassine Bounou (Morocco) Born in Montreal, Bounou knows his first selection with Morocco in 2013. The porter who evolves in Girona (Spain), proves to be the conductor of a defense that has allowed Morocco to continue three clean sheets (no goal cashed). Solide.IconSport



Charles Andriamanitsinoro (Madagascar) You would be wrong not to remember his name. Charles Andriamanitsinoro, it's two goals with Madagascar, against Guinea and Nigeria. With 7 points during the group stage, and for his first participation in the CAN, the Malagasy selection is the surprise of this competition.IconSport



Youssouf Kon√© (Mali) We know him well in France since he played at LOSC, Youssouf Kon√© has a very different CAN than he had in 2017, where he was more represented on the bench of substitutes. Mali can rely on its defender to go far in the competition.IconSport

Can 2019: Top 5 players in the group stage




The story continues for Nabil Dirar. The winger reconverted lateral defender on several occasions tried the adventure in Turkey two years ago now. And at 33, the player trained in Belgium decided to reunite with Fenerbahce until 2022.








The calendar of Fenerbah√ße

Yeni Matalyaspor - Fenerbahce: 24/11/2019
